Posted By: Kindulas (2/16/2011 9:36:34 PM)

posts.post_content:
This card IS, in fact, power creeped.  
It has abilities that outclass virtually every other 6-drop, and it has a 6/6 body for six mana on an artifact.  
That's way better than black, blue, red, and sometimes white get without some sort of drawbacks. Instead of drawbacks, it has two incredible keywords, and an extremely powerful ability.  
It's ridiculous, and it puts pretty much every other 6-drop to shame
posts.html:

Posted By: Radagast (10/14/2010 9:37:04 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
I have seen a few comments about powercreep and I have to intervene, taking the point that powercreep has both a: not screwed up the game at all and b: isn't nearly as bad as it was before.  
  
Case for point a: Powerful cards are fun, this is a game and thus is supposed to be fun. Wurmcoil engine makes the person playing it feel powerful, and the person playing against it has a challenge. I love playing against cards like this and Jace because it gives me a challenge, especially for someone who doesnt play those cards and opts for more rogue and fun decklists. If anything, the powercreep has made the game more fun and more challenging to play. Secondly, the powercreep is checked by simple removal spells. Any competent player knows not to waste removal, and this guy right here has a ticket for a journey to nowhere. Note, I am not saying that this card is bad because it can be targeted by removal, absolutely not. I am saying that this card is checked, balanced by the duresses and despises ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
